Mark Nottingham wrote:

> I don't see how sending a POST to get the POE link leads to a 
> chicken-and-egg problem, unless you also need the "get the form" 
> operation (which really should be a GET) to be reliable as well. Even if 
> you did, you can always bootstrap it with one that isn't required to be 
> reliable.

I agree. I think POE is sound, formally speaking.

The chicken and egg problem I've see is that, because HTTP is asymmetric 
(clients always initiate), then it's possible that either the client or 
the server gets confused as to where things are at because the client 
never got the response, or never got the response in time. I assumed 
that out of HTTPLR by saying infinite requests will result in infinite 
responses. Protocol axioms are wonderful that way ;)

cheers
Bill
